External Projects

Our external projects directly affect a third party. Most of our external projects are in partnership with an external company who has commissioned us to complete the project. The findings and outcome of the projects usually are designed specifially for these companies.


AQDrone
Project Information

The AQDrone project was an assessed innovation task as part of Birmingham City University's Innovation Fest.

Awards

AQDrone won the award for the best Health and Safety related project.

Partners

We worked with the following companies to complete this project:

  • The Things Network
Project Team
  • Eleanor Railton
  • Sam Dugmore
  • Daniel Lockyer
  • Tilly Davies
  • Joshua Walker
Flying High
Project Aim

The Flying High project aims to explore the future use of drones in urban areas across the West Midlands.

Action Plan

The West Midlands was chosen to take part in a national challenge to explore how unmanned drones can be used in urban areas. Birmingham City University will take lead in the networking aspect of the project. See our Connected Birmingham project for more information.

Partners

We're working with the following companies to complete this project:

  • West Midlands Combined Authority
  • Coventry University
  • Birmingham Airport
  • Coventry Airport
  • Rockwell Collins
Project Team
  • Adel Aneiba
  • Luke Tainton
  • Eleanor Railton
  • Sam Dugmore
  • Daniel Lockyer
  • Tilly Davies
  • Joshua Walker
Birmingham Air Quality
Project Aim

The Birmingham Air Quality project aims to assist in monitoring air quality across Birmingham and providing meaningful information to help improve it.

Action Plan

We plan to develop several air quality sensors and install them in locations across Birmingham. These sensors will measure the amount of PM2.5 and PM10 and feed the data back to a data analytics platform. This platform will map the data and highlight areas of the city that need improvement.

Partners

We're working with the following companies to complete this project:

  • West Midlands Combined Authority
  • Department of Health
  • The Things Network
Project Team
  • Shadi Basurra
  • Sam Dugmore
  • Abigail Cresswell
  • Luke Tainton
